sentences.sentence: For two days, despite our best efforts and to Holmes’ great surprise and disappointment, we could discover no news at all of the Aurora.
On the third Holmes left early, asking me to handle any messages or telegrams that came.
At three o’clock that afternoon Mr. Athelney Jones was shown up to me.
But this was no longer the man who had taken over( 接管 ) the case so confidently at Upper Norwood.
His expression was downcast( 垂头丧气的 ), and his look was meek( 温顺的 ) and even apologetic.
“Good-day, sir,” said he. “Mr. Sherlock Holmes is out, I understand.”
“Yes, and I cannot be sure when he will be back.”
“I have had to reconsider my theory,” said my guest. “I had my net drawn tightly round Mr. Sholto, but he was able to prove an alibi( 不在场证明 ) which could not be shaken.
From the time that he left his brother’s room he was never out of sight of someone or other. So it could not be he who climbed over roofs and through trap doors( 通气门 ).
My professional( 职业的 ) reputation is at stake( 处于危险境地 ), and I should be very glad of a little assistance.”
“We all need help sometimes,” said I.
“Your friend Mr. Sherlock Holmes is a wonderful man, sir,” said he, in a confidential voice.
“I had a telegram from him this morning, by which I understand that he has got some clue( 线索 ) to this Sholto business. Here is the message.”
He took the telegram out of his pocket, and handed it to me.
It was dated from Poplar at twelve o’clock.
Go to Baker Street at once [it said]. If I have not returned, wait for me. I am close on the track of( 追踪 ) the Sholto gang( 一伙（罪犯） ). You can come with us tonight if you want to be in at the finish.
A heavy step was heard climbing the stair, with a loud panting( 喘息 ) as from a man who was out of breath( 喘不过气 ).
Once or twice he stopped, as though the climb were too much for him, but at last he made his way to our door and entered.
His appearance corresponded( 符合 ) to the sounds which we had heard.
He was an old man, in sailor’s clothes.
His back was bent, his knees were shaky( 摇晃的 ), and his breathing was painfully asthmatic( 气喘的 ).
He gave me the impression of a respectable sailor who had fallen into poverty( 贫困 ).
“What is it, my man?” I asked.
He looked about him in the slow methodical fashion( 方式 ) of old age.
“Is Mr. Sherlock Holmes here?” said he.
“No; but I am acting for( 代表他行事 ) him. You can tell me any message you have for him.”
“It was to him himself I was to tell it,” said he.
“Well then, you must wait for him.”
“No, I won’t lose a whole day to please anyone. If Mr. Holmes isn’t here, then Mr. Holmes must find it all out for himself. I don’t like the look of either of you, and I won’t say a word.”
He shuffled( 拖着脚走 ) towards the door, but Athelney Jones got in front of him.
“Wait a bit, my friend,” said he. “You have important information, and you must not walk off. We shall keep you, whether you like or not, until our friend returns.”
“You will be none the worse,” I said. “We will pay you for the loss of your time. Sit over here on the sofa, and you will not have long to wait.”
He came across reluctantly, and seated himself with his face resting on his hands.
Jones and I continued smoking our cigars and talking.
Suddenly, however, we heard Holmes’s voice.
“I think that you might offer me a cigar too,” he said.
We both jumped in our chairs.
There was Holmes sitting close to us with an air of( 具有...的神态 ) quiet amusement.
“Holmes!” I exclaimed( 惊呼 ). “You are here! But where is the old man?”
“Here is the old man,” said he, holding out a heap of( 一堆 ) white hair.
“Here he is—wig( 假发 ), whiskers( 连鬓胡子 ), eyebrows( 眉毛 ), and all. I thought my disguise( 伪装 ) was pretty good, but I hardly expected that it would stand that test.
I have been working in that outfit( 全套服装 ) all day,” said he, lighting his cigar.
“You see, a good many of the criminal classes begin to know me—especially since our friend here took to publishing some of my cases.
Therefore, I need a disguise( 伪装 ) like this. How is your case coming along?”
“It has all come to nothing. I have had to release( 释放 ) two of my prisoners, and there is no evidence against the other two.”
“Never mind. We shall give you two others instead of them. So long as you do exactly as I say, you are welcome to all the official credit. Is that agreed?”
“Absolutely, if you will help me find the men.”
“Well, firstly I shall want a fast police-boat—a steam launch( 汽艇 )—to be at the Westminster Stairs at seven o’clock.”
“That is easily managed. There is always one about there, but I can step across the road and telephone to make sure.”
“Then I shall want two strong men, in case of resistance.”
“There will be two or three in the boat. What else?”
“When we secure the men we shall get the treasure.
I think that it would be a pleasure to my friend here to take the box round to the young lady to whom half of it rightfully( 正当地 ) belongs.
Let her be the first to open it. Eh, Watson?”
“It would be a great pleasure to me.”
“Rather an irregular proceeding,” said Jones, shaking his head. “However, the whole thing is irregular, and I suppose we must wink at( 睁一只眼闭一只眼 ) it.
The treasure must afterwards( 之后 ) be handed over to the authorities( 管理当局 ) until after the official investigation( 调查 ).”
“Certainly. One other point. I would like to have a few details( 详细情况 ) about this matter from Jonathan Small himself.
There is no objection to my having an unofficial interview with him, either here in my rooms or elsewhere, as long as he is efficiently guarded?”
“Well, you are master of( 控制 ) the situation. I have had no proof( 证据 ) yet of the existence of this Jonathan Small.
However, if you can catch him, I don’t see how I can refuse you an interview with him.”
“That is understood, then?”
“Perfectly. Is there anything else?”
“Only that I insist upon your dining with us. It will be ready in half an hour.
I have oysters( 牡蛎 ) and two grouse( 松鸡 ), and a good white wine.
Watson, you have never yet recognized my merits( 优点 ) as a housekeeper.”

article_info.previous: 早餐时分Holmes在报纸上发现了有关此次事件的报道，正是警探Athelney Jones的那一套理论。餐后Holmes和Watson又一次讨论起那个神秘的同伙，Holmes不再卖关子了，最终他们发现这个同伙正是来自于印度Andaman岛的野蛮人。
article_info.share_words: Here he is—wig, whiskers, eyebrows, and all. I thought my disguise was pretty good, but I hardly expected that it would stand that test. I have been working in that outfit all day.

question.cn: 在接下来的两天里Holmes有得到任何有关Aurora号的消息吗？
question.en: Did Holmes discover any news of the Aurora in the following two days?

analysis: 文中提到：“For two days, despite our best efforts and to Holmes’ great surprise and disappointment, we could discover no news at all of the Aurora. ”因此答案选B。

question.cn: Mr. Athelney来的时候，看起来怎样？
question.en: How did Mr. Athelney look when he came?

options.cn: 他看起来和之前一样自信。
options.en: He looked as confident as before.

analysis: 文中提到：“At three o’clock that afternoon Mr. Athelney Jones was shown up to me. But this was no longer the man who had taken over the case so confidently at Upper Norwood. His expression was downcast, and his look was meek and even apologetic.”因此答案选B。

question.cn: 他们对那个水手打扮的老人做了什么？
question.en: What did they do to the old man in sailor’s clothes?

options.cn: 他们强迫老人说出消息。
options.en: They forced him to tell the message.

analysis: 文中老人准备离去时，Athelney对他说：“You have important information, and you must not walk off. We shall keep you, whether you like or not, until our friend returns.”因此答案选C。

question.cn: 为什么那个老人后来就不见了？
question.en: Why did the old man disappear afterwards?

options.en: Because that was just Holmes in disguise.
Because the old man ran away secretly.

options.cn: 因为老人在房间里藏了起来。
options.en: Because the old man hid himself in the room.

analysis: 文中提到：“‘Here is the old man,’said he, holding out a heap of white hair.‘Here he is—wig, whiskers, eyebrows, and all. I thought my disguise was pretty good, but I hardly expected that it would stand that test. . . ’”因此答案选A。

question.cn: 寻回宝藏箱后Holmes有什么要求？
question.en: What was Holmes’ request after recovering the treasure chest?

options.cn: 他们应该立即打开箱子。
options.en: They should open it at once.

options.cn: Miss Morstan应该是第一个打开箱子的人。
options.en: Miss Morstan should be the first to open it.

options.cn: 在审讯之前任何人都不得打开箱子。
options.en: Nobody should open it before the trial.

analysis: 文中提到：“When we secure the men we shall get the treasure. I think that it would be a pleasure to my friend here to take the box round to the young lady to whom half of it rightfully belongs. Let her be the first to open it.”因此答案选B。

share_title: 100天读完4本英文书，今天是第37天
